name: Jello Salad
description: Jello salad is a sweet, creamy, popular dessert thatâ€™s easy to make and always a crowd favorite for potlucks, picnics, and holidays!
recipeIngredient: 20 oz canned crushed pineapple in juice (drained & juice reserved)* ($1.49)

recipeInstructions.text: Wash, remove the stems, and quarter the strawberries. Feel free to cut any large pieces in half again. Set the strawberries to the side.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash, remove the stems, and quarter the strawberries. Feel free to cut any large pieces in half again. Set the strawberries to the side.

recipeInstructions.text: With a strainer and a small bowl, drain the crushed pineapples really well and reserve the pineapple juice.
recipeInstructions.name: With a strainer and a small bowl, drain the crushed pineapples really well and reserve the pineapple juice.

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender*, add the strawberry gelatin, cottage cheese, and â…“ cup of the reserved pineapple juice. Blend until smooth then add the mixture to a large bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: In a blender*, add the strawberry gelatin, cottage cheese, and â…“ cup of the reserved pineapple juice. Blend until smooth then add the mixture to a large bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Next make the whipped cream. In a separate metal or glass bowl, preferably a bowl that has been chilled in the refrigerator, add heavy cream, vanilla extract, and granulated sugar. Use a hand mixer or stand mixer to whip the cream on high until stiff peaks form. Stop the mixer occasionally to test the stiffness of the peaks and to avoid over whipping.
recipeInstructions.name: Next make the whipped cream. In a separate metal or glass bowl, preferably a bowl that has been chilled in the refrigerator, add heavy cream, vanilla extract, and granulated sugar. Use a hand mixer or stand mixer to whip the cream on high until stiff peaks form. Stop the mixer occasionally to test the stiffness of the peaks and to avoid over whipping.

recipeInstructions.text: Now carefully fold the whipped cream into the strawberry gelatin mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Now carefully fold the whipped cream into the strawberry gelatin mixture.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the crushed pineapples and chopped strawberries to the bowl and carefully fold them into the whipped cream mixture until everything is evenly distributed.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the crushed pineapples and chopped strawberries to the bowl and carefully fold them into the whipped cream mixture until everything is evenly distributed.

recipeInstructions.text: Refrigerate jello salad for at least 2 hours so the ingredients have a chance to set and chill before serving. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Refrigerate jello salad for at least 2 hours so the ingredients have a chance to set and chill before serving. Enjoy!

review.reviewBody: My grandma used to make a variation of this, with peaches and peach Jell-o. She didn't use a blender, but she would mix the Jell-o with the peaches, then fold in the cottage cheese, and lastly, she would fold in the Cool Whip.

Christina T. - Check out your Goodwill or similar store. It should be easy to pick up an inexpensive blender with which you can do many things.

Now, I'm ready to make this Jello Salad for my church supper.
But what if I don't have a blender? Is there another way I can blend the ingredients? ðŸ˜¢
